After dinner, Lorraine’s grandmother puts on a CD. “It’s holehole bushi,” she explains, “the songs our grandmamas used to sing in the canefields. Each song is so short, but so filled with emotions and memories.” She sings along with the songs.

In the CD cover, there’s a translation of one of the songs which you find very beautiful. Listen to the songs and match the lyrics with the most appropriate Japanese.
